step1.title: Detection
step1.description: The system detects legacy database files and calculates migration requirements.

step2.title: Backup
step2.description: Automatic backups are created to ensure data safety before migration begins.

step3.title: Migration
step3.description: Data is transferred from legacy databases to the new unified system.

step4.title: Validation
step4.description: The migrated data is validated to ensure integrity and completeness.

q1.question: How long does the migration take?
q1.answer: Migration time depends on the amount of data. Typically, it takes 2-10 minutes for most users.

q2.question: Is my data safe during migration?
q2.answer: Yes, automatic backups are created before migration begins, and the original files are preserved until migration is confirmed successful.

q3.question: Can I cancel the migration?
q3.answer: Yes, you can cancel the migration during the process. The system will safely stop and restore the previous state.

q4.question: What happens if migration fails?
q4.answer: If migration fails, the system automatically restores from backups and provides detailed error information to help resolve the issue.

q5.question: Do I need to restart the application?
q5.answer: The application may restart automatically after successful migration to ensure all components use the new database system.
